airbyte_connection.title: airbyte_connection
airbyte_connection.description:
`AirbyteConnection` representing the Airbyte connection to
trigger and wait for completion of.

AirbyteServer.title: AirbyteServer
AirbyteServer.description: A block representing an Airbyte server for generating `AirbyteClient` instances.

username.title: Username
username.description: Username to authenticate with Airbyte API.

password.title: Password
password.description: Password to authenticate with Airbyte API.

use_ssl.title: Use SSL
use_ssl.description: Whether to use SSL when connecting to Airbyte server.

AirbyteConnection.title: AirbyteConnection
AirbyteConnection.description: A block representing an existing Airbyte connection.

airbyte_server.title: Airbyte Server
airbyte_server.description: AirbyteServer block representing the Airbyte instance where the Airbyte connection is defined.

connection_id.title: Connection Id
connection_id.description: UUID of the Airbyte Connection to trigger.

poll_interval_s.title: Poll Interval S
poll_interval_s.description: Time in seconds between status checks of the Airbyte sync job.

status_updates.title: Status Updates
status_updates.description: Whether to log job status on each poll of the Airbyte sync job.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for requests made by httpx.AsyncClient.

description.summary: A flow that triggers a sync of an Airbyte connection and waits for it to complete.
examples:
Define a flow that runs an Airbyte connection sync:
```python
from prefect import flow
from prefect_airbyte.server import AirbyteServer
from prefect_airbyte.connections import AirbyteConnection
from prefect_airbyte.flows import run_connection_sync

airbyte_server = AirbyteServer(
    server_host="localhost",
    server_port=8000
)

connection = AirbyteConnection(
    airbyte_server=airbyte_server,
    connection_id="<YOUR-AIRBYTE-CONNECTION-UUID>"
)

@flow
def airbyte_sync_flow():
    # do some things

    airbyte_sync_result = run_connection_sync(
        airbyte_connection=connection
    )
    print(airbyte_sync_result.records_synced)

    # do some other things, like trigger DBT based on number of new raw records
```

kubernetes_job.title: kubernetes_job
kubernetes_job.description: The `KubernetesJob` block that specifies the job to run.

KubernetesClusterConfig.title: KubernetesClusterConfig
KubernetesClusterConfig.description:
Stores configuration for interaction with Kubernetes clusters.

See `from_file` for creation.

config.title: Config
config.description: The entire contents of a kubectl config file.

context_name.title: Context Name
context_name.description: The name of the kubectl context to use.

KubernetesCredentials.title: KubernetesCredentials
KubernetesCredentials.description: Credentials block for generating configured Kubernetes API clients.

KubernetesJob.title: KubernetesJob
KubernetesJob.description: A block representing a Kubernetes job configuration.

v1_job.title: Job Manifest
v1_job.description: The Kubernetes job manifest to run. This dictionary can be produced using `yaml.safe_load`.

api_kwargs.title: Additional API Arguments
api_kwargs.description: Additional arguments to include in Kubernetes API calls.

credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.description: The credentials to configure a client from.

delete_after_completion.title: Delete After Completion
delete_after_completion.description: Whether to delete the job after it has completed.

interval_seconds.title: Interval Seconds
interval_seconds.description: The number of seconds to wait between job status checks.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace to create and run the job in.

timeout_seconds.title: Timeout Seconds
timeout_seconds.description: The number of seconds to wait for the job run before timing out.

description.summary: Flow for running a namespaced Kubernetes job.
description.returns: The a dict of logs from each pod in the job, e.g. {'pod_name': 'pod_log_str'}.
examples:
```python
from prefect_kubernetes import KubernetesJob, run_namespaced_job
from prefect_kubernetes.credentials import KubernetesCredentials

run_namespaced_job(
    kubernetes_job=KubernetesJob.from_yaml_file(
        credentials=KubernetesCredentials.load("k8s-creds"),
        manifest_path="path/to/job.yaml",
    )
)
```
